result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen K May was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge

06-03-2015 The Court orders the Judgment of Conviction be amended to reflect that the correct amount owed to the Drug Task Force is $535

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit to random drug and/or alcohol screening; this is to occur at least one time per month for the first three months after release from jail, and thereafter as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of controlled subtances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no contact with Derak Schultz
--no contact with any known drug user or drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, with an exception for persons Mr. May is required to have contact with through school or employment 
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--the Jefferson County Sheriff is to collect a DNA sample from Mr. May; the Court empowers the Sheriff to only collect one sample as to this case and case #15CF27; the Court authorizes to not collect a second DNA sample, rather than collecting two samples in these two cases

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: of the SENTENCING HEARING ON REVOCATION held on September 29, 2016 before the  HONORABLE DAVID J. WAMBACH

[MK] case called at 1:18pm. 
Defendant Allen K May in court, in custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Counsel acknowledge receipt of the Revocation documents and indicate that there are no factual corrections to be made to the Revocation Summary.
The Court acknowledges receipt of a letter from Pastor Lovick, written in support of the Defendant. 
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Rhiel; during this argument the Defendant's mother, Cynthia May, makes a statement. 
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall.
Mr. May makes a statement. 

On Count #3, the Court sentences Mr. May to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years and 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years and 6 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.
The Court finds that Mr. May is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. May is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 90 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to pay the costs and fees of this action; the Court indicates to the clerk that the Revocation Summary indicates that the amounts specified are $711, $237.24 for DNA surcharge, and $92 for victim witness surcharge
--no contact with Derak Schultz
--no contact with  Rick Garcia  
--no contact with Julian Patterson 
--no contact with Daniel Franco
--no contact with any persons that Mr. May knows are drug users or drug traffickers, whether they have been convicted or not, unless authorized by the Agent for group therapy or for NA meetings 
--the previous conditions of Probation are adopted as Extended Supervision conditions:  
[these conditions are: 
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit to random drug and/or alcohol screening; this is to occur at least one time per month for the first three months after release from incarceration, and thereafter as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of controlled subtances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent]


Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Firearm prohibition warnings are given 
recess 2:05pm.
from Attorney Witt re: September 29, 2016 Hearing
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Letter from the defendant requesting discovery and a JOC
Letter from the defendant ref money owed
Request to reinstate huber is denied
Letter from the defendant requesting his huber be reinstated
Letter from the defendant requesting huber be reinstated
To amend JOC to correct amount owed for Drug Task force
With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #15CF27 and #15CF70 called at 9:30am. 
Defendant Allen K May in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. May. 
The Court finds there is victim rights compliance. 
recess 9:35am, reconvene 9:40am. 
As to both cases:   Mr. May waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
 Service of Information admitted, reading waived.
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1 on Case #15CF27, and on Count #3 of Case #15CF70; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 in Case #15CF27, and Counts #1 & #2 in Case #15CF70.

On Count #1 in Case #15CF27, the Court sentences Mr. May:
--serve 12 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on May 6th, 2015 at 7:00pm. 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. May is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--to submit a DNA sample; the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office is to obtain this DNA sample from Mr. May 
--pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge= $518, plus $125 in drug testing fees which is joint and several with Derak Schultz if Co-Defendant Schultz is convicted in Case #15CF29), to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 6/29/15 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 11 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive



On Count #3 of Case #15CF70, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. May on Probation for three years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit to random drug and/or alcohol screening; this is to occur at least one time per month for the first three months after release from jail, and thereafter as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of controlled subtances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no contact with Derak Schultz
--no contact with any known drug user or drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, with an exception for persons Mr. May is required to have contact with through school or employment 
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--the Jefferson County Sheriff is to collect a DNA sample from Mr. May; the Court empowers the Sheriff to only collect one sample as to this case and case #15CF27; the Court authorizes to not collect a second DNA sample, rather than collecting two samples in these two cases
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to reimburse drug buy money in the amount of $335


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given 
recess 10:14am.
Status conference on April 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Allen K May
Current: 513 Washington Ave, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 03-25-2015)
Prior: 322 Jones Avenue, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

Cases 15CF27, 15CF29 and 15CF70 called at 9:02am [mo]
Co- Defendant Allen K May in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. 
Co- Defendant Derak Schultz in court with Attorney  David Zarwell.
ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Both Defense counsel report that there is ongoing case settlement discussions that now include newly filed cases. 

As to Mr. Shultz, Atty. Zarwell indicates that 2 additional cases filed against Mr. Shultz, cases are 15CF57 and 15CF71, further Atty. Zarwell indicates the defense recieved a global offer from state today.   
Recess: as to case 15CF29 only at 9:12am--Atty. Zarwell and Mr. Shultz exit the courtroom 

As to case 15CF70: 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
The Court order that the Bail in case 15CF27 extend to case 15CF70, with the additional condition No Contact Tommie Herman

recess:9:18am  

NEXT:  Case: 15CF29 (1) Pretrial Conference on April 15,2015 at 2:40   (2) Status Conference on 4/28/15 at 9:30 [[JA- note in comments case is at Prelim stage]]]
            Cases 15CF27 & 15CF70: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/15/15 at 2:00pm (2) Status Conference on 4/28/15 at 9:30am [[JA- note in comments case is at Prelim stage]]]
             Cases 15CF57 and 15CF71 should be both be scheduled for Initial Appearance on March 31st at 2:00pm
